bash.name: Bash
bash.description:
Bash scripting is widely used for automation tasks and infrastructure scripts.

**Key Benefits:**
- Universal availability on Unix-like systems
- Good for system automation and DevOps tasks
- Easy integration with command-line tools

**Usage:**
- CI/CD pipeline scripts
- Local development automation
- System administration tasks

docker.name: Docker
docker.description:
Docker is our primary container platform for packaging and deploying applications.
We use it extensively across all projects for consistent development and production environments.

**Key Benefits:**
- Ensures consistency across different environments
- Simplifies dependency management
- Enables easy scaling and orchestration

**Usage:**
- Development environments via docker-compose
- CI/CD pipelines for building and testing
- Production deployments

github-actions.name: GitHub Actions
github-actions.description:
GitHub Actions is our standard CI/CD platform for all sommerfeld.io projects.

**Key Benefits:**
- Native integration with GitHub repositories
- Extensive marketplace of ready-to-use actions
- Good support for matrix builds and workflows

**Usage:**
- Running linters and tests
- Building and pushing Docker images
- Automated releases with semantic-release
- Scheduled tasks and housekeeping

mkdocs.name: MkDocs
mkdocs.description:
MkDocs is being evaluated as our documentation platform, using Material theme.

**Key Benefits:**
- Simple markdown-based documentation
- Beautiful Material Design theme
- Easy to deploy to GitHub Pages

**Status:**
Currently testing across projects to determine if it meets our documentation needs.

python.name: Python
python.description:
Python is used for automation scripts and tooling where Bash is insufficient.

**Key Benefits:**
- Rich ecosystem of libraries
- Good for complex automation tasks
- Better error handling than Bash

**Status:**
Currently used in select projects, evaluating for broader adoption.

semantic-release.name: semantic-release
semantic-release.description:
semantic-release automates version management and package publishing based
on conventional commits.

**Key Benefits:**
- Automated versioning based on commit messages
- Generates changelogs automatically
- Ensures consistent release process

**Usage:**
- Version bumping in CI/CD
- Changelog generation
- GitHub release creation

taskfile-(task).name: Taskfile (Task)
taskfile-(task).description:
Task is our standard task runner, replacing Make with a more modern and user-friendly approach.

**Key Benefits:**
- Simple YAML syntax
- Cross-platform compatibility
- Built-in features like variables and includes
- Better error handling than Make

**Usage:**
- Project build automation
- Development workflows
- Standardized across all repositories

yamllint.name: yamllint
yamllint.description:
yamllint is our standard linter for YAML files, ensuring consistency and catching syntax errors.

**Key Benefits:**
- Catches YAML syntax errors early
- Enforces consistent formatting
- Integrates well with CI/CD pipelines

**Usage:**
- Pre-commit hooks
- CI/CD pipeline validation
- Local development checks
